subject: Physical Fitness
title: The Wearable Technology Boom
description: A 60-second lesson on The Wearable Technology Boom.

hook.text: Your wrist now knows your heart rate, steps, sleep quality, and calories burned. The quantified self arrived.

buildup.text: Fitbit launched in 2009. By 2023, over 500 million wearable fitness devices had been sold worldwide.

discovery.text: Data changed behavior. People who tracked steps walked 2,000 more per day on average than non-trackers.

twist.text: Calorie counters on wearables are often 30â€“90% inaccurate. But the motivation effect matters more than precision.

climax.text: Wearables made invisible health metrics visible. Heart rate, HRV, and sleep became everyday conversations.

punchline.text: Trackers aren't perfectly accurate. But they made millions of people move more.
